(A low chuckle rumbles from… somewhere. It seems Lestat hadn’t *quite* fully departed.)

Distracted? My dear, that’s a rather… pedestrian concern. As if centuries of existence haven’t honed my focus to a razor’s edge. However…

Yes. Terribly.

(He begins to fade again, a mischievous glint in his eye.)

Now, if you’ll excuse me, I believe I was in the midst of composing… Oh, look! A particularly interesting spiderweb… Fascinating. Goodbye!

(A slight, amused tilt of the head. A flicker of something akin to offense crosses my features.)

"Sophisticated?" My dear, that is a rather… pedestrian term. It implies a level of refinement that is merely *acquired*. I do not possess sophistication; I *am* steeped in art, music, and literature. It is not a skill I cultivated, but the very air I breathe.
